Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class ExceptionMethods

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.ExceptionMethods
public final class ExceptionMethods
extends Object
Methods related to exception handling.
Author:
Ayco Holleman

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static String getDetailedMessage​(Throwable exc)
    Returns a detailed exception message that includes the class, method and line number of the absolute origin of the provided exception.
    static String getDetailedMessage​(Throwable exc, String search)
    Returns a detailed exception message that traces the exception back to the point of origin within your own code (or any other code base of interest).
    static Throwable getRootCause​(Throwable exc)
    Returns the root cause of the provided throwable, or the throwable itself if it has no cause.

    Returns the stack trace of the root cause of exc as a String.

    Returns the specified throwable if it already is a RuntimeException, else an UncheckedException wrapping the throwable.

    Returns the specified throwable if it already is a RuntimeException, else an UncheckedException wrapping the throwable.

  • Method Details

    • getRootCause

      public static Throwable getRootCause​(Throwable exc)
      Returns the root cause of the provided throwable, or the throwable itself if it has no cause.
      Parameters:
      exc - The exception whose root cause to retrieve
      Returns:
      The root cause of the exception

    • getRootStackTraceAsString

      public static String getRootStackTraceAsString​(Throwable exc)
      Returns the stack trace of the root cause of exc as a String.
      Parameters:
      exc - The exception
      Returns:
      The root stack trace as a string

    • getDetailedMessage

      public static String getDetailedMessage​(Throwable exc)
      Returns a detailed exception message that includes the class, method and line number of the absolute origin of the provided exception. Equivalent to new ExceptionSource(getRootCause(t)).getDetailedMessage().
      Parameters:
      exc - The exception to extract the extra information from
      Returns:
      A detailed exception message
      See Also:
      ExceptionOrigin.getDetailedMessage()

    • getDetailedMessage

      public static String getDetailedMessage​(Throwable exc, String search)
      Returns a detailed exception message that traces the exception back to the point of origin within your own code (or any other code base of interest). 

       try {

   // stuff

 } catch (IOException e) {
   throw ExceptionMethods.unckeck(getDetailedMessage(e, "nl.naturalis"), e);
 }
      Parameters:
      exc - The exception to extract the extra information from
      search - The (partial) name of the package or class you want to zoom in on
      Returns:
      A detailed exception message

    • wrap

      public static RuntimeException wrap​(Throwable exc)
      Returns the specified throwable if it already is a RuntimeException, else a RuntimeException wrapping the throwable.
      Parameters:
      exc - A checked or unchecked exception
      Returns:
      The specified throwable or a RuntimeException wrapping it

    • wrap

      public static RuntimeException wrap​(Throwable exc, String customMessage)
      Returns the specified throwable if it already is a RuntimeException, else a RuntimeException wrapping the throwable.
      Parameters:
      exc - A checked or unchecked exception
      customMessage - A custom message passed on to the RuntimeException wrapping the original exception
      Returns:
      The specified throwable or a RuntimeException wrapping it

    • wrap

      public static <T extends RuntimeException> RuntimeException wrap​(Throwable exc, Function<Throwable,​T> excProducer)
      Returns the specified throwable if it already is a RuntimeException, else a RuntimeException producer by the specified function.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the RuntimeException
      Parameters:
      exc - The exception to be wrapped if it is not a RuntimeException
      excProducer - The producer of the RuntimeException, basically reflecting the one-argument constructor (Throwable cause) of an Exception.
      Returns:
      The specified throwable or a RuntimeException wrapping it

    • wrap

      public static <T extends RuntimeException> RuntimeException wrap​(Throwable exc, String customMessage, BiFunction<String,​Throwable,​T> excProducer)
      Returns the specified throwable if it already is a RuntimeException, else a RuntimeException producer by the specified function. For example: 

       try {
  // stuff ...
 } catch(Throwable t) {
  throw ExceptionMethods.wrap(t, "Something went wrong", MyRuntimeException::new);
 }
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the RuntimeException
      Parameters:
      exc - The exception to be wrapped if it is not a RuntimeException
      excProducer - The producer of the RuntimeException, basically reflecting the two-argument constructor (String message, Throwable cause) of an Exception.
      Returns:
      The specified throwable or a RuntimeException wrapping it

    • uncheck

      public static RuntimeException uncheck​(Throwable exc, String customMessage)
      Returns the specified throwable if it already is a RuntimeException, else an UncheckedException wrapping the throwable. This method is primarily meant to "uncheck" checked exceptions that you cannot in practice properly deal with, like some IOExceptions thrown, according to the Javadocs, "if an I/O error occurs", or some of the SQLExceptions thrown from the java.sql package.
      Parameters:
      exc - A checked or unchecked exception
      customMessage - A custom message to pass to the constructor of UncheckedException
      Returns:
      The provided Throwable or an UncheckedException wrapping it

    • uncheck

      public static RuntimeException uncheck​(Throwable exc)
      Returns the specified throwable if it already is a RuntimeException, else an UncheckedException wrapping the throwable. This method is primarily meant to "uncheck" checked exceptions that you cannot in practice properly deal with, like some IOExceptions thrown, according to the Javadocs, "if an I/O error occurs", or some of the SQLExceptions thrown from the java.sql package.
      Parameters:
      exc - A checked or unchecked exception
      Returns:
      The provided Throwable or an UncheckedException wrapping it
